website_summaries.verdict: The bezel-cut panel and 1080p picture quality allow for clear viewing from any angle, and the 22" screen is large enough for long work periods without taking up much desk space.
pros: Able to accommodate standard HDMI and VGA connections, this model can be used with all commonly used office or workplace devices and PCs
Clear LED picture reduces contrast and blur for less eyestrain when working, and the display settings are simple to customize
While the screen is large enough for easy viewing, users who want to save a little space for other items or devices will appreciate the screen's compact size
cons: This model is designed for traditional computer use, and the refresh rate, response time, and screen size are not ideal for users who want a monitor for gaming

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this 27in LED monitor! Working great and looking great since first plugged in. This is my main monitor...center in a 3 monitor array..flanked by 2 Viewsonic 23in monitors. If the smaller ones go out, I'll replace with a 27 like this. Surely would buy again. Replaced am older LG LCD that quit. (Pics to show array...had to block the work out :-)
customer_reviews.author: JCE_TX

customer_reviews.title: The 23" I didn't like and tried to cancel the 27" but I miss ...
customer_reviews.text: This is for the VA2759-SMH 27". I order the 23" by mistake and reorder the 27". The 23" I didn't like and tried to cancel the 27" but I miss the cutoff. I decided to go ahead and try the 27" inch and love it. If you're thinking of buying make sure you get the 27". The best monitor I have ever had. I have 3 24" Samsung on my desk at work and 2 Dell 2415 and 1 VA2759-SMH ViewSonic. I also just gave my son my ASUS VH238H. Again this is what I have own in the last 3 years. I have own many over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Oone day at a time

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor for working remotely
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when the shelter-in-place began, since I was going to be working remotely for a while. It was easy to plug in to my laptop, the picture is very clear and sharp, and the base it sits on is sturdy. I do a lot of video editing with this monitor and the size and clarity has been so nice to have instead of staring at my much smaller laptop all day. I’d definitely recommend this monitor. The price was very reasonable and the quality is great.
customer_reviews.author: J. Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable value
customer_reviews.text: As I weigh out what I paid versus what I got, everything passes the reasonability test. I'm happy. "Frameless" is subjective. There is very thin exterior bezel then another .2' frame wrapping the viewable area. Someone wanting a seamless multi-monitor setup would be mildly disappointed. Outstanding picture quality for this segment, which is the only thing I needed. The ntegrated speaker is pretty miserable as expected. It does have a phono headphone jack, though the amplifier is 2/3 (at best) from what one would expect being plugged into the tower and has no physical volume controls.
customer_reviews.author: Eidsvik

customer_reviews.title: Great Return Opportunity...
customer_reviews.text: My bad for assuming that in 2019 AD, ordering a decent monitor would be a slam dunk... Nope. The thing didn't come with a VGA-HDMI adapter (what modern laptop still has VGA ports?) and the ultra-cheap plastic base is only weeks away from ravaging your fine home wood surface. The screen is set just low enough to ensure poor neck posture and enrich your chiropractor...and of course its height is not adjustable. Lame.
customer_reviews.author: Reluctant Avid Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Very good display, -1 star for terrible stand
customer_reviews.text: For my pretty basic needs, this is a really nice monitor at the right price point. I was still using an old 20" HP monitor that dated back to approx 2010, so anything was probably going to be a step up. Not sure if I got a dud, but the stand was really bad. Easy to assemble, but the bottom left side of the monitor sagged and, no matter what I tried, it wasn't level. This was would have, over time, driven me insane. In the long run, I probably would have bought a better mount, but this accelerated it, so my total cost was the cost of the monitor plus $35.
customer_reviews.author: E. Bower

customer_reviews.title: Shoddy documentation
customer_reviews.text: The monitor itself looks pretty good but the manual and the location of the controls suck. No diagram or photo of the controls to adjust the screen, which are hidden underneath with a skill that rivals a teenage girl hiding her diary. Adjusting things like color and brightness involves groping around blindly underneath the unit for tiny bumps and doing the old hit and miss hoping for some favorable outcome because you have no idea what does what or where it might be. Would it be too much trouble to put these things on the side or anywhere that you could see them?
customer_reviews.author: Calvin

customer_reviews.title: No way to remove the stand arm
customer_reviews.text: After mounting it to the VESA mount, I removed the single screw from the top of the stand arm. I can see how it is supposed to slid off. It is not going to slid off unless I use a hammer or other impact tool to jerk it out. This of course will ruin the LCD. Take home story: If you want to VESA mount this and have it look good, or mount multiple on top of each other (vertical stacking) I recommend you chose a different line.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Monitor failed twice in 12 months
customer_reviews.text: When it works, I like it a lot. However, I am about to send this one in for the second time. It will be covered by warranty, but the shipping costs to get it fixed are significant. I am actually thinking about buying something else instead.
customer_reviews.author: DJB

customer_reviews.title: Cured my eye/ strain migraines.
customer_reviews.text: Was having migraines from day trading on my 3 year old asus Monitors and stumbled across an article entitled “7 best monitors for eye strain reviews 2020. In the testimonials I read where a person having migraines was cured using the Viewsonic VX 2427 mhd24. The flicker free and blue light filter technology cured my migraines as well, and for a bargain price.
customer_reviews.author: Wilson Horne

customer_reviews.title: Great home office monitors with VESA mounts
customer_reviews.text: These are great monitors for my home office. I needed reasonable priced 1080p monitors that had VESA mounts for my home office, as we moved and I now work remotely from home. The color, brightness, clarity and controls are all good for my usage. Notes: I have not used for gaming so have no opinion on that. I also have not used them for photo editing yet. So no report on the color accuracy but as far as I can tell so far the Native color setting after adjusting the brightness and contrast for the lighting in my room is plenty good. (I run the contrast at 65 and brightness at 69)
customer_reviews.author: SoCal-colin

customer_reviews.title: Bright, but poor volume control and control labels.
customer_reviews.text: Nice bright image. What I don't like is that there is no easy way to control the built-in speakers. They don't respond to the computer volume controls. It is a real pain not to have a way to mute them or adjust the volume without going into the screen menu and hitting a bunch of buttons. AND the buttons are labeled so poorly, you can't see the markings, especially when the bright monitor is on. I'm attaching a picture to show the original and with toothpaste rubbed on them.
customer_reviews.author: Rollin River

customer_reviews.title: Using two as dual monitors for home office
customer_reviews.text: Bought two to use as dual monitors for my home office. I plug them into a docking station for my laptop. I can’t say if they would be good for gaming or not, but they work great for my office. I really like the thin bezel. One thing to keep in mind though is that the actual image doesn’t actually go all the way to the bezel. There’s a little bit of room in between, which gives a little bit of a gap between the two pictures. This won’t be an issue if you’re using one monitor, but will show if using two like me. But I really can’t complain for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Very grainy - both text and graphics very hard to view.
customer_reviews.text: THIS MONITOR IS A PIECE OF JUNK. The display is very grainy. Text is very hard to read. Graphics is very bad - vertical and horizontal lines are very 'dotty' with black lines crossing them. I have two older 25 inch Viewsonic monitors and they do not have this problem. This is the second 27 inch Viewsonic monitor I ordered from Amazon - both have the same exact problem. Looks to me like the lower-priced monitors are being fitted with very low quality LCD panels. Be careful if you decide to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Venu P. Gopal

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny...
customer_reviews.text: I work in live music production and this monitor is really hard to beat for the price. It's survived thousands of miles inside a pelican case and fires up every day without issue. I'm using an arm and not the included base so I can't comment on it. That said this thing gets quite a few comments from the peanut gallery at every show and the overall picture quality is great. My monitor in the studio costs twice as much, slightly larger at 34" but I don't miss it. It's really tough to beat this one for the price..
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: For the price....
customer_reviews.text: This is a great buy! If you're looking for a cheap monitor that can get you into the gaming scene with a new build or if you're just needing a monitor to get you going this one right here is a great one to go with. The near bezeless edging is great and the picture doesn't look half bad. Now I'm not a color snob or anything if that sort, but there were no dead pixels and I didn't notice and black light bleed at all. Overall, great entry level monitor or a great office pc monitor. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: UnholyV3nd3tta

customer_reviews.title: Color rendering seemd off
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this monitor based on the good reviews but was ultimately disappointed enough with it to request a return. Its a nice looking monitor and the display was crisp and bright, however there was a green tint to the colors that no amount of fiddling could correct. Black also appeared washed out at default settings. I literally spent hours trying to compensate for these issues via both the monitors adjustments and my video card settings as well as trying the different input ports but couldn't get results that were acceptable to me. In fairness it could be just an aesthetic dislike on my part but I found it disagreeable enough to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Anon 7

customer_reviews.title: Awful display
customer_reviews.text: What a disappointment. Washed out display. Can't even view some pages or content. Contrast is very poor. Poor blacks. Color hue can't get to a normal image. And yes, I've spent too much trying working the controls. Going back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: ddskg

customer_reviews.title: Great screen
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these on a pole stand hooked up to my Mac Mini (2012), as part of my stand up desk. I am in front of those screens 60+ hours a week. As displays, they are just perfect. Now, if you think you're going to get decent audio out of these, I have a unicorn to sell you. The little speakers sound more tinny than a bad cell phone and the volume control embedded deep in the menu system is basically unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Hutchings

customer_reviews.title: Solid Deal in a Monitor
customer_reviews.text: I have this hooked up to an older Mac Mini and it performs very well. It easily switched out for my older, smaller monitor and give me a bigger screen without taking up much more desk space. I can't speak to its performance for gaming, but it does the job for my general-purpose computing, video editing, and image processing while being easy on my budget and my work space.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon S. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Decent economical monitor
customer_reviews.text: I bought this monitor for my son's computer. So far, it is working out very well for him. In my office I use an LG Ultrafine 5k, and of course, there's a very noticeable difference in quality; however, for the price, you really can't beat this monitor. The only thing that threw me for a bit was the fact that it only works if you power on the monitor BEFORE the computer it's connected to. If you fail to do this in the right order, the monitor will be stuck with a "No Signal" error on the screen. It took me awhile to figure this out.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew D. Huwiler

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor, a little blurry.
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a second monitor for my laptop at work. Its the right size and works great. My only issue is the picture quality. Its noticably blurry compared to my laptop. The color appears to be about the same on both devices. I use the stand for my desks and I have no issues with it staying upright and i bump it at least daily. I dont use it for sound so I cant comment on that.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE TO REVIEW
customer_reviews.text: Customer Service is Top Notch ! I contacted them when my monitor had the problems shown above on two occasions. The first time I sent it for repair on my dime. The second incident ( very shortly after getting the monitor back ) the company paid for shipping and replaced my monitor with a new one. The new monitor has a very clear picture and color is great. Yes I do recommend, based on customer service !
customer_reviews.author: P. Ledbetter

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price point.
customer_reviews.text: As being on a limited budget, I had limited choices in price range. Giving that factor I am totally happy with the image. Sharpness is very good, color balance is very good along with the brightness. Common with this type of monitor is the speakers are horrible, this one is no different. Note I said "common", so in consideration this is actually a very good monitor for the price. If you want to listen to music, get a set of good desk speakers. It's a monitor not a TV.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry Greenstreet

customer_reviews.title: fantastic picture
customer_reviews.text: Admittedly, this monitor replaces a decade-old Acer flat screen, but the difference in picture quality still blows me away every time I look at it. Text on the screen practically jumps out at you, and as for gaming...all I can say is "Wow!" Setup took me all of five minutes, most of that spent attaching the base. It was a true plug-n-play, no driver downloads or anything to do. The monitor was a great deal as well. I can recall paying $600 for a Viewsonic CRT monitor back in the day, over three times what this one cost.
customer_reviews.author: Hawk23510

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes it just stops receiving a signal
customer_reviews.text: This is a great display and I like it in general. However, sometimes it just looses the signal and I have no idea why, I tried changing the cable, I even tried a different GPU, it has to be the display. All I need to do to fix it is turn it off and back on, but it’s still annoying. Maybe it was damaged during transport, maybe it’s a defect, maybe it’s a problem with the display software, I don’t know. Next time I’ll probably get a different brand though.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: It's a decent monitor for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Again, for the money, there is really nothing to complain about. I use two monitors for my business, so I compared it to my other monitor, which is an Acer - probably around the same price range, maybe slightly less. The only difference I can see is that there's a white undertone to the screen on the Viewsonic, while the Acer is bluer. I do graphics, and I can work with either just fine. (In the first picture is both the Acer & Viewsonic; the Viewsonic is on the right. The second picture is the Acer; the third, the Viewsonic.)
customer_reviews.author: The Carington Kid

customer_reviews.title: Cheap stand, monitor is tilted to the right and no way to adjust
customer_reviews.text: Good picture but the stand is really cheap and the monitor is tilted to the right. There is no way to adjust the stand to correct this, so for now I had to put paper under the right side of the stand to make it level. The monitor sits pretty low and there is no way to adjust the height, so I put it on top of an old book. I would have spent extra money to pay for a better stand. Also the speakers sound terrible. I'm not sure why they bothered adding them. The sound is way better coming from my laptop. Now I will have to play with the monitor settings to turn off the speaker...
customer_reviews.author: S. Chase

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor
customer_reviews.text: We only use ViewSonic monitors at work and this was a replacement of one I dropped on concrete :-/ Picture quality is great , but sounds is only for reference. The other thing I like about this monitor is that you can completely remove the stand and bracket without tools. Of course it's not safe if you move it around, but once it's on its desk the monitor is stable and won't fall. Regular IEC for power, and analog and digital inputs. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: claudio

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly but good picture
customer_reviews.text: The monitor works great. Easy connections and clear picture. Unfortunately, I can't get it to stay in place. It's quite wobbly in its stand and no amount of tuning or tightening seems to work to fix it. Even just adjusting my web cam, which sits lightly on top, makes the entire unit list and go crooked. I'll give it a few more days to see if I can handle the constant adjusting, but sadly this is likely going back.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Colors are washed out and faded
customer_reviews.text: Ok for occasional use, but if you use your monitor regularly, get something different. The colors are really washed out on this and things are a bit blurry. I thought it might simply be an issue with my video card, but I tried a different monitor this size and the screen quality was nice. I'm returning this monitor because it will create too much eye strain.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Read before buying
customer_reviews.text: Really don't know how this monitor got such a high rating. Dead pixels after 30 seconds of usage and it is not an edgeless screen as people might think. It is frameless but the screen does not go to the edge. See photos. Just got the acer and its great.
customer_reviews.author: anikko

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expecting but satisfactory
customer_reviews.text: I was a little disappointed that this only goes up to 1920 resolution but I should have researched that more. It only has VGA and not DVI which is another let down. It is a bright clear display though. The normal hue seemed yellowish so I set it to "cool" which was a little better. It does the job but in future I will get a higher resolution monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Alco933

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these monitors. I do love them, but calling them “frameless” seems misleading to me. There is no plastic frame around the screen, but you should expect about half-inch black bars at least on all sides of the viewing area, the actual led screen does not allow “infinity screen” type of setups where the picture extends to the farthest edge.
customer_reviews.author: Runningoutofspace

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY!!! Missing necessary part and very poor quality speaker
customer_reviews.text: This monitor comes up with no HDMI, you will have to purchase it separately. I called the customer service center, but they are trying to convince me to buy a cable paying myself. I think it is ridiculous that merchandise not providing necessary cable, just like buying a house without a door. In addition, the speaker quality is very poor. the audio sounds like a regular speaker covered by plastic bag. not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: StarBoy

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE - Cant remove base for VESA mount
customer_reviews.text: Update: It took me good 15 min and a hammer to get the base out and thankfully did not break anything. The monitor itself is thin and nice. Upgrading to 4 star. ------------- I bought this unit primarily as second monitor to mount using VESA. No way to remove the base even after removing the screw. Bad design. I am trying to use a hammer but might break the unit. Will return it if I can't remove.
customer_reviews.author: cchi

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor and reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new monitor since my old one had some bad spots (2nd hand monitor) and wanted one a little bigger for working at home. I love the split screen capability unfortunately not all my work programs accommodate it but the majority of readily available programs seem to work fine. The larger size is a big plus too! I’m not a gamer so I did not rate that capability.
customer_reviews.author: phillygirl

customer_reviews.title: Older man needing to work on a computer
customer_reviews.text: I spend many hours each day on my computer. As I got passed 70 I began to notice eye strain because text wasn't as clear as it used to be. I switched to this high resolution screen and the eye strain disappeared. It has excellent settings for brightness and other settings that help my viewing.
customer_reviews.author: Susan G. Dowgiewicz

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this based on the positive reviews but it's a big disappointment. I am using this for work, not gaming, so I don't have high demands, but the display is dull with no apparent way to change it (even after updating the drivers), and the sound is no better than that from my laptop. To top it off, I could have saved $20 by buying this discontinued model directly from ViewSonic.
customer_reviews.author: JaxShopper

customer_reviews.title: Very good monitor
customer_reviews.text: Really no documentation. You can figure out how to adjust without much difficulty. There is a PDF on the Viewsonic web site if you need it. The picture is great. My biggest issue is there is no height or swivel adjustments. I should have read the questions. Nothing mentioned in the add itself. Whoever decided the height sits pretty low. I could put a book under it if I really need to. Overall it's a very good monitor for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Chris R. Kern

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this monitor when I had to start working from home. I used to have 2 monitors at work, 23”, and having this 27” is a real change. I didn’t know what I was missing with smaller monitors. Now I can see more and do more without scrolling so much. Easy to set up and works great. I wish it had USB ports on the side, like the ones at work, but I can adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Greg F.

customer_reviews.title: Buy an extended warranty (As with all cheap products), worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought four of these for different people, used them for a little over a year. All function well, apart from one suffering with strange interference issues on a multiple monitor setup. It's the monitor itself that flickers, swapped equipment out before. Apart from that issue, functional, effective, surprisingly loud built in speaker, good controls, nice image quality for a cheap IPS panel.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Bosworth

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, controls are a little bit of a pain
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up for an older PC that we set my son up with. We have no issues with the connections, volume, or picture. The controls are a little cumbersome, but we don't use them much as we control it with the PC. The base takes up more room than is probably necessary, so if you're in a really small space, you might consider a different mount.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Mollett

customer_reviews.title: Great for MAME Cabinet
customer_reviews.text: Used for a 25” (on inside) wide arcade cabinet, to replace. 4:3 large CRT. At 24.5” width dimension, this fit perfectly; was the largest monitor I could find that fit. Using it with an intel nuc was trivial, performance for arcade style games more than adequate, and even though the ratio is for mame (should be 4:3), this was large enough as to not matter too much.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Bright and Viewable from a wide angle
customer_reviews.text: Very good image quality; a nice upgrade from my old 768p 17 inch monitor. The IPS helps a lot too; no longer have to keep reaching forward to make adjustments to tilt the screen. The instructions for adjusting the brightness, etc. are on line; just punch in the model number on your search engine. The stand it comes with is a POS, but I was going to mount it on an arm anyway; it's set up for that with the VESA mounting holes. As for the speakers: forget it. About the same quality as a cheap laptop's underside speakers. So I bought a speaker bar that attaches to the monitor.
customer_reviews.author: ronosan

customer_reviews.title: Good for what it is.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these monitors to start setting up a 4 - 6 monitor tower for work. They work fine. The picture quality is fine for running office apps, I'm not doing anything with high intensity graphics. I was really disappointed when I came back for more that, while Amazon says the price dropped by 11%, it actually has gone up by $10 per monitor compared to my original order. Frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: JustMe

customer_reviews.title: D.O.A. (Dead on arrival) UNHAPPY CUSTOMER
customer_reviews.text: Opened when it arrived today and there were scratches on base and a marking on monitor edge. ALSO! With HDMI plugged in it did not turn on! Defective product. I looked up the manual online since it didn't have one and although the monitor turned "on" (the power button light showed orange then blue) the screen was not displayed. Returning!
customer_reviews.author: Shuttereyes

customer_reviews.title: Hard to Attach Base
customer_reviews.text: I love this monitor, but I had to give it 4 stars because the base was a little difficult to install. The problem was screwing it in after attaching the base to the monitor. The screw was extremely difficult to turn. Had to stop turning with the screw driver because it would have worn out the threads. Had to resort to a pair of pliers, which also had it's limits because the grooves did not allow me to screw in as tight as I would have liked to. So there is still a little portion of the screw that was not totally screwed in. I have to be very careful when moving it, or lifting it for any reason.
customer_reviews.author: bohemian gurl

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first week with this monitor and I very pleased thus far. Its all its advertised to be. I am still waiting to get and test the Bose PC speakers I ordered a week later, but meanwhile I haven't had to use my headphones a single time due to how great the built-in speakers of the monitor have been working for me. They don't exactly compare to actual PC speakers, but they will more that do the job when/if they have to. I just hope it doesn't die on me after 1yr use like my previous ViewSonic.
customer_reviews.author: Jayzon

customer_reviews.title: Returning the monitor
customer_reviews.text: I requested a return and someone from Amazon called. Viewsonic was closed because of the holiday so Amazon called after the holiday which I missed the call. I sent an email an expected a return call but it did not happen. I have had the monitor for 8 days and cannot resolve the issue so I'm returning it. It's clear but I cannot increase the brightness to reduce the eye strain.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product nearly every day for a couple of months. It is great because it has a very large and very clear display. What I like best is that the overall dimensions of the monitor allowed for a perfect fit in the computer desk that I own. I realize that the built in speakers are low quality but they are perfect for my needs on my computer.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hohlman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my 31.5” 1080p television (Model NS-32L450A11) which I had been using for browsing and writing. With the default settings the picture is clearly better, especially when viewing text. The 28” size works better for me; I would consider going back to the larger size only if the bottom of the screen can be within a few inches of the desk. The stand on this monitor allows pivoting (but not sliding) up and down but I really didn't need to make an adjustment. I am very satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tim G

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Chinese sweatshop product.
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea why this product is rated higher than 2 stars. The monitor comes with HDMI cable. You have to spend another $20 to buy it. The stand is not stable and it wiggles like a bobble doll. The resolution is not great. You can see dots clearly on the screen. Do not buy this monitor. Get LG or Samsung.
customer_reviews.author: Rumi

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor
customer_reviews.text: I love this monitor. The colors are vibrant, the resolution is great. Just absolutely love the crisp, clear graphics. I use this as a main monitor display on an arm, so it's nice to have less weight to drag the arm down and stress the springs, plus this displays my graphics, artwork, video games... everything... so beautifully. Couldn't be happier with the quality of the display. And it worked perfectly right out of the box. The integration of speakers into the monitor was a nice perk.
customer_reviews.author: 📚 Bookwyrm 📚Top Contributor: Brewing

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price, but consider the Asus MX279H
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor for the price, but I'd step up to the "ASUS Designo MX279H 27" Full HD 1920x1080 IPS HDMI VGA Frameless Monitor" if you have the extra money. We now have about a half-dozen 27" monitors, including this one, and it stands up fine with the rest. We've always bought ViewSonic's and will continue to when budget is an issue, but the clarity of picture and the quality of the built-in speakers on the Asus make that one worth the price, if you can afford it. (This monitor does come with built-in speakers but they simply aren't as good as the ASUS, in my opinion.)
customer_reviews.author: Houston Gray

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: With WoW Classic coming back out, I wanted to play again. I had recently bought an HP sceptre laptop that was perfect for my non-gaming needs. It runs the game just fine, but needed a bigger viewing area. This monitor shipped fast and has great picture quality. I am a fan of viewsonic brand, and this is just one more product that they hit it out of the park with.
customer_reviews.author: Meghann Neeley

customer_reviews.title: Good General Purpose Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Really simple setup, basically plug and play with Windows 10. YouTube and Netflix movies are exceptional, color and movement. There is a builtin speaker that is ok, I typically use a higher quality Bluetooth speaker instead of the built in speaker. There is no video camera associated with the monitor, so it would not be good for video chat. For the price it is an excellent general purpose monitor.
customer_reviews.author: RG0647

customer_reviews.title: Home office
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these monitors to upgrade my home office set up, that i use at least half of the work week. so far so good with what i need the monitors for. i haven't used them much yet for watching video for extended amount of time. lost a star since the description says each monitor included an HDMI cable and none were found in either box.
customer_reviews.author: HR

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Monitor with a Very Thin Bezel
customer_reviews.text: Used as a secondary monitor in portrait in a dual monitor setup. Very good for this purpose as it has a VESA 100 mount and a very thin bezel so the monitor setup is as seamless a possible.
customer_reviews.author: Hillary Smith

customer_reviews.title: A Good Monitor for Photo or Video Editing
customer_reviews.text: I use this monitor for photo editing and it calibrates well. It's only a 1080P resolution but thats OK. It fits well on my desk and replaces a ten year old HP IPS monitor that is slowly giving up the ghost. Not much more to say because it does what it was designed for and does it well.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Karoly

customer_reviews.title: Nice color, brightness and clarity
customer_reviews.text: I am not using it for gaming, response time is not an issue. I have been buying ViewSonic monitors for all my computers, excellent quality at a reasonable price. I selected this particular model because it has HDMI input and built-in speakers.
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Value in a Monitor
customer_reviews.text: The base was a bit difficult to remove (for mounting on a taller stand), but other than that this is a very good monitor for the price. Not sure I'd use it for graphic design, high-end photo or video editing, or gaming, but for business use it's excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Willie V. HughesTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool for the cash
customer_reviews.text: Nice monitor. I just use it for word processing and some surfing around so I'm not a gamer or an online movie buff. The picture looks nice and is a little tricky to adjust but it's not impossible. It's just different from my other monitor so with time it will get easier. I like the stand also. It's substantial with a huge footprint for good balance. I also like this monitor because it was not too expensive.
customer_reviews.author: WTF2016

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price
customer_reviews.text: If you have to be very precise with the color, this is not the monitor for you! Picture is very bright, and if you are working a spreadsheet, or writing letters, or just surfing the web; it is a good (and large enough) display. I do photography and videos, and it can't be compared to the Apple Cinema Display (27 inches as well as this one). The one advantage that this monitor has over my previous one, is the "IPS" technology, which is a huge plus!
customer_reviews.author: Carlos E. Read

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality display
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality display. Viewsonic is known for quality monitors and I have owned them previously which is why I bought another one. The base on this is not as substantial as I would prefer - it has a bit of wobble when you are manipulating the controls and on/off switch. But as long as you are not on a ship or having an earth quake I think you will be okay. :)
customer_reviews.author: sturner

customer_reviews.title: Nice IPS Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Nice IPS monitor at a good price. Works well with a FHD 2k notebook computer through a HDMI cable. No problems. Used mainly for google searches and word processing. Great to have all the screen room. Speakers are OK to good. Some monitors don't have speakers..
customer_reviews.author: Dillon-MT

customer_reviews.title: Great for HDMI not so much for VGA
customer_reviews.text: I love VIEWSONIC MONITORS! But while this is crisp as can be when plugged into the HDMI, it shows a lot of ghosting when plugged into my VGA port. Kind of disappointing because my others are clear both ways but they are smaller... I still really like it!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas James

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfactory as a treadmill TV, but get speakers.
customer_reviews.text: Not your 4K living room resolution, but does 1080 nicely. If spoiled by your 4k, you may monkey with settings a bit, but will arrive at something you can enjoy. Get a switch and HDMI audio splitter, a Roku streaming stick, plug in your second room cable box, a wall mount Bluetooth speaker, and you will pretty much have Treadmill Theater... 4 stars due to sound... Look at me, I apparently now have a home gym...
customer_reviews.author: HRJ

customer_reviews.title: Not bright, not sharp.
customer_reviews.text: Brightness and contrast do not work well. Even at max brightness it is like 50% of my working setting on laptop. Resolution is not sufficient for reading text.
customer_reviews.author: Ak2

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't accept latest drivers from ViewSonic
customer_reviews.text: Tried updating the driver for this monitor and kept saying monitor doesn't exist. Don't know if this is a ViewSonic knockoff, but returning it. Too bad, this replaced my old ViewSonic which I had for 15 years. They must be building these monitors with cheap parts....
customer_reviews.author: Dolores H

customer_reviews.title: Got two, one failed immediatly.
customer_reviews.text: Got two monitors for a dual set up. The first worked fine, the second lasted 5 minutes before it turned off and smelt like fried electronics. Was quickly replaced with free return slip. I have no complaints about the one that worked, good picture for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: IceAndSnow

customer_reviews.title: The colors were dull and washed out.
customer_reviews.text: The colors were dull, washed out and it looked like a film was on the monitor. Very noticeable when side by side with my old Asus monitor. Maybe I received a bad unit, but a few other reviewers said the same thing. Playing with the brightness, contrast, color adjustment and other settings did not help. I had to return it, no way can I use this side by side with my other monitor with the colors as dull as they are. This is a minor point, but I thought the power cord was very short as well. The power cord into the monitor has three circles, it is not the typical rectangle with two corners cut off.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: It is an excellent monitor, but I was given one free
customer_reviews.text: This Monitor represent excellence! The customer service is excellent! My issue was taken care promptly. I returned it in the original package unopened, But I use the same brand 15 years. I highly recommend the seller!
customer_reviews.author: Katalin Hosseinian

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor, has good colors, no dead pixels, was easy to mount. Comes with built-in speakers that work if no other option but it's not great. Than again, it's a monitor. As I don't game I can't say anything about the performance in gaming but for office use, writing emails etc. this is great.
customer_reviews.author: RadioChemistry

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this Viewsonic monitor.
customer_reviews.text: I am not a techie or a high-end computer user but I am satisfied with this monitor. Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Very good TV - good pic, nice design, native sound a little tinny
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a great TV for the price. It has a nice slim design. The built-in Roku features are great. It hooks up to a sound bar nicely - which you may want to consider getting because the built-in speakers have a bit of a tinny sound that can get lost in a big room. We haven’t had any problems with it at all.. and it mounts nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Goldblum

customer_reviews.title: ViewSonic VA2259-SMH 22 Inch IPS
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of the 22" Viewsonic LED Monitors to replace my older 20" LCD Screens; and what a difference in over quality and sharpness. These units are a great option for a Dual-Monitor setup. Very happy so far, and I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: R.E.S..

customer_reviews.title: Base is a little wobbly.
customer_reviews.text: The monitor functions well, my only complaint is that it's a little bit wobbly. The base is not really that sturdy, and with my keyboard on the same table with it, it can move back and forth a little bit as I type. I'll have to see if there's a way I can support it a little better but otherwise I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Norman Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Monitor for the Money !
customer_reviews.text: Read a lot of reviews before deciding to purchase this particular monitor - which was highly rated and they were accurate. Great monitor and a very reasonable price! Sharp picture and simple to use menu functions to customize the display if desired, but the factory settings straight of the box were just right for me.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: Viewsonic, my go to monitor
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Viewsonic products for many years and have always been satisfied. While this 23" unit is 7 Sq. In. smaller than my previous 22" unit, the aspect ratio works out better. These units are economical. I have two units that I use for video production and the horizontal space and brightness are great. Three plus feet of horizontal work area. I have two workstations outfitted with these monitors.
customer_reviews.author: Al D

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor for a small desk area/great price
customer_reviews.text: This was perfectly adequate and for the price, I'm very satisfied. The monitor does need an extra HDMI-HDMI cord (or other types of cords) not included. Was easy to setup and the picture quality is decent.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen F. Trask

customer_reviews.title: Great for office use
customer_reviews.text: I bought another monitor to connect to my laptop. I want sure of the picture quality until I started to use it. The picture is clear and bright. The monitor has its own settings so if the brightness or contrast doesn't work out, you can change it. The audio coming from the laptop wasn't exactly great but for my needs it didn't matter.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Connect
customer_reviews.text: This monitor works great....when it connects. Sometimes it'll be plugged in and the screen will not turn on. It will show as "No Signal." Then suddenly, hours later, the monitors will display. Its very frustrating. Happens a lot.
customer_reviews.author: D. McComb

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Monitor worked great for approximately 60 days (just outside of Amazon's return policy) then began blinking for approx .5/secs every 10 minutes. It has now been 5 months since I purchased this monitor and it is virtually useless. The screen now blinks every 30 seconds for approx 1-2 seconds. I have tried every different screen setting and reset the monitor several times a day to no avail. I plan to order another monitor by a different manufacturer and never order another ViewSonic product.
customer_reviews.author: J E Prince

customer_reviews.title: Great for general viewing.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my uncle and his new PC that I am setting up. I am impressed with the picture quality considering it is full HD and not UHD. Screen is bright and picture is crisp and clear. I am considering one for me and one for my wife.
customer_reviews.author: Rob G

customer_reviews.title: Poor sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Good size, but quality of sound is poor. Very tin like. Ordering a sound bar and hoping it will help. Not sure if it is the monitor, but it shuts off with no signal while listening to Pandora. I move the mouse and it comes back on. Never did this with my Dell monitor. Internet shows full connectivity. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Frizelle

customer_reviews.title: Well, it was working great....
customer_reviews.text: Well, it was working great for a few weeks and then it decided it did not want to connect to my computer and all I get is "no signal" on the screen. I thought maybe it was by HDMI cord so I bought a new one and I bough a VGA adapter. NOPE! Still getting "no signal".
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer M

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Monitor
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several View Sonic Monitors. I have never had any bad issues with any of them. For the money they are just awesome. I will buy another like this in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Val E. Simone

customer_reviews.title: Bigger is Best!
customer_reviews.text: I love this large screen. My desk should be deeper so that I can sit farther away. The picture is clear, crisp, and realistic. I just watched my first movie on it and I loved it. I moved up from a 20 inch monitor. I often enlarge the picture or the printed emails and I can still see the who email because the scree is so wide.
customer_reviews.author: Hampton and ShaRon

customer_reviews.title: I really like this monitor
customer_reviews.text: I really like this monitor. I ordered the 22" no frame version and I really like it. It has awesome resolution and I had no driver issues to setup. The package was also superior and concealed that it was a monitor. Several years ago I ordered a monitor from another store and it was delivered in the original packaging and left on the front porch, so the packaging was also important to me.
customer_reviews.author: BM2

customer_reviews.title: Excellent monitor! has VESA mount built in!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 3 of these to use together in my home office, couldn't be more pleased. They are very thin and light. The frameless design makes dual monitor or triple monitor setups more seamless. The biggest selling point on these monitors for me is the built in VESA mounting holes, which for some reason aren't included in many monitors today, causing you to buy bulky adapters to mount them.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Good screen, poor speakers.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this model because it had built in speakers. The speakers are terrible! Tinny and cheap sounding. My iphone has better sound. Otherwise it seems to be a good monitor screen wise.
customer_reviews.author: J.F.

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC but....
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of the exterior and the display is fantastic! The only note would be- as far as I could tell, the base of the monitor stand doesn't detached from the monitor, myself and several friends have attempted multiple times. The bottom part of the stand comes unattached to the stand mount and I am still able to mount the monitor onto a dual monitor arm. Though, it looks a bit weird that the base of the stand is still attached. Something to consider is you are planning on mounting the monitor onto to something other than the provided stand.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor and great price.
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with this monitor and the price. No gap on the sides or top for picture quality, and it’s very light weight for the size. The split screen software you download from the ViewSonic website works well too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: The clarity this monitor gives is outstanding. There is almost no physical border, giving me the maximum benefit for the screen size. I've purchased Viewsonic for many years now and continue to believe they are unbeatable.
customer_reviews.author: Stan C

customer_reviews.title: great screens for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I got two of these for my home office. Cheap options, but they were recommended from my company. The screen is very cool, and frameless. The quality of the picture is not the best, but you will not find anything better near to the price you pay for this product. Overall very happy with my purchase, I knew what I was getting for the money I spent.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: No HDMI cord defeats purpose of buying budget monitor.
customer_reviews.text: This product only comes with a VGA cord. No HDMI cord. Having to purchase a separate HDMI cord defeats the whole purpose of buying a budget monitor. Otherwise, monitor is fine. Purchased for student use and seems to serve the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I got it to replace my old monitor that gave out, and I am very happy about my purchase, I got it for $110 and it does the job very well. The screen is large, though I'd be careful transporting it. Keep the original packaging, as it is very easy to put back in to move it somewhere. It seems like it would be fragile without the original packaging. The speakers are okay, but I didn't buy it for the speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: After 5 months of occasional use, this monitor started displaying wide bands of mis-colored pixels. Cycling power fixes the issue for a short while, before the pixel mis-coloring returns. Buy a different monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: Nice monitor
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this monitor. It is exactly what I wanted. Very easy to hook up and has a very bright, clear, and sharp image and really nice colors. It came well packaged and in good condition. I would recommend this to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

product_meta.title: ViewSonic VA2259-SMH 22 Inch IPS 1080p Frameless LED Monitor with HDMI and VGA Inputs, Black
product_meta.description: Size:22-InchThe ViewSonic VA2259-SMH is a 22” (21. 5” viewable) full HD LED monitor designed for both office and home use. With Super clear IPS panel technology, this monitor offers best-in-class screen performance with ultra-wide viewing angles. Vivid 1920x1080 resolution and dual speakers, combined with a sleek edge-to-edge frameless design, deliver an immersive viewing experience for home entertainment and multimedia applications. What's more, the minimalist design of this monitor makes it perfect for nearly seamless multi-screen setups. HDMI and VGA inputs deliver flexible connectivity options for both computing and gaming environments, while ViewSonic exclusive view mode feature provides intuitive presets for optimized screen performance in different applications. In addition, flicker-free technology and a blue light filter help to minimize eye strain from extended viewing periods. With ViewSonic industry-leading 3-year limited warranty, This monitor is a solid long-term investment for enterprise and home applications. Voltage - AC 100-240V (universal), 50-60Hz. The brightness is 250 cd/m2
feature_bullets: GREAT FOR HOME AND OFFICE: An ideal all-around display for desktop, or laptop
SEE THE DIFFERENCE: Razor-sharp clarity and detail with Full HD (1920x1080p) resolution
AMAZING AT ANY ANGLE: A thin bezel IPS panel ensures stunning views no matter your vantage point
FLEXIBLE CONNECTIVITY: The VA2259-SMH supports laptops, PCs, Macs, and POS systems with HDMI, and VGA inputs
INDUSTRY-LEADING WARRANTY: 3-year coverage with access to our US-based customer service team
INCLUDED IN THE BOX: LCD Monitor, Power Cable, Audio Cable, and VGA Cable

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,579 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
